title: Data Analyst (Internship)
description: As a Data Analyst, I gathered data from sensors across the Caux Seine Agglo territory.
Data was received via: Automatic SFTP drop, CURL, Manual upload.
I developed a Python API to collect these feeds and upload them into our PostgreSQL database.
I cleaned the data to remove possible sensor errors or human interference.
I created dashboards with ArcGIS to visualize and export the data on maps.
Since the dashboards were used by both Caux Seine Agglo staff and external users (such as mayors), I regularly led meetings and gathered feedback to improve the tools.
I had to write a full documentation in order to help workers to use my app but also for new developers to be able to maintain my code.

title: FullStack developer (Internship)
description: During this internship, I worked on a web application for the same company as my first internship.
I had to develop a mobile app using Flutter to allow their client to track their shipments in real time using multiple APIs.
I also had to develop and maintain web tools using JavaScript, PHP and Python to help the company manage their shipments and clients.
I've worked mainly using Jira's ticketing system to plan my work.
Since my apps were intended to be used by many people, I had to write documentation for each app or modification I've made.
I've also had to learn Git and Gitlab in order to version my code and work with multiple developers on the same project.

title: Help desk technician (Internship)
description: On my first internship, I worked as a helpdesk technician for a worldwide import export company.
I had to manage the company's Database in MSSQL and fix bugs in their WMS.
Most of my work was to help workers with their issues on our software by taking control of their computer using a remote control tool or by fixing the data directly in the database.
I had to work in real time on production data, so I had to be very careful and precise in my work while doing the fastest as I could to avoid downtime.
Since most of the workers were not very tech-savvy, I had to explain to them how to use the tools and how to fix their issues by themselves.
Since most of my work was repetitive, I had to automate some tasks using Python scripts, SQL stored procedures and PHP scripts to save time and avoid human errors.
